intro: Sterculia richardiana, commonly known as the African tallow tree, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical Africa and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces woody pods that contain small, hard seeds. It is often grown for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine. Its growth habit makes it suitable for use as a shade tree or in ornamental landscaping.
